intro: Nesoluma polynesicum, commonly known as the Tahitian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and clustered in terminal inflorescences. The fruit, which ripens in late summer, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor.
